article.title: Chadic_languages
article.paragraph: TheChadic languagesare a branch of theAfroasiatic languagesAfroasiaticlanguage familythat is spoken in parts of theSahel. They include 150 languages spoken across northernNigeria, southernNiger, southernChad,Central African Republicand northernCameroon. The most widely spoken Chadic language isHausa languageHausa, alingua francaof much of inlandWest Africa.
article.heading: Composition
article.paragraph: Newman (1977) classified the languages into the four groups which have been accepted in all subsequent literature. Further subbranching, however, has not been as robust; Blench (2006), for example, only accepts the A/B bifurcation of East Chadic.Blench, 2006.The Afro-Asiatic Languages: Classification and Reference List(ms)
